There is a major difference between adult healthcare services and children healthcare services. This article is to let you know the major differences, so that you feel better prepared.

child healthcare services

  • focuses on the family
  • doctor will talk to both of you about healthcare
  • doctor may spend much more time getting to know your parents and you
  • family relationship would be strong since the doctor has seen you grow from a child to a young adult
  • if your under 18 years, your parents consent is needed
  • parents make the final decision for you
  • doctors office would be colorful and warm
  • doctors office is rich in resources like child life and other resources just in one place

adult healthcare services

  • focuses on the person
  • doctors office lacks vibrancy and color
  • appointments may feel shorter
  • may need to find your community resources
  • if your above 18 years, you grant the permit
  • you make the final decision

how children are different from adults

when disaster occurs, the effects are different when both age-groups are viewed. You can learn more about the unique needs of children before and after disasters by clicking here

You’ll have to know first of all that children’s bodies are way different from adult bodies. They’re also more likely to get severely injured and sick. Here is why:

  • children have thinner skin and an extra of it per body weight
  • children breathe in more air per body weight
  • they are prone to lose much body heat
  • they spend much time playing on the ground
  • children have less fluid in their bodies, so fluid loss can be dangerous

It is also a known fact that children needs help from adults in times of an emergency, and the reasons are:

  • they do not know the safety precautions
  • when danger occurs they either cry, scream or freeze
  • they’re unlikely to tell you what is hurting them
  • most laws in each country of the world requires adults to make medical decisions for a child
  • there is limited or no information on the effects of certain illnesses on children
  • they are more likely to be cared for when they have their parents around

According to health reports, mental stress is hard on children, some of them are:

  • they have no inkling about the situation
  • they have less sense of control in such matters
  • children lack experiences when it comes to bouncing back from disastrous situations

here are doctors your child needs 

As soon as your child is born, he or she is going encounter different medical professionals. These people are basically there to answer your questions and also help your child. Some children only see the family doctor throughout their growing years, while others may frequently see the dentist or allergist. Here are some of the medical professionals that help your children.

child dentist

As soon as your child gets his or her first tooth, it is high time you visit the dentist. According to reports from the  American Dental Association, it is stated that children should have their first dental appointment within 6 months of their first cut tooth. This visit to the dentist would include a whole examination of the mouth so as to help your child have a healthy teeth.

optometrist

Your child naturally would have his or her first eye examination in the delivery room. The doctor would have to examine your child’s eye to know if its in perfect condition. Most times, the school nurse would have to partner with the optometrist so as to report if something is found funny with your child’s vision.

family doctor

This is generally the family’s choice. They meet the children’s need as well as the family’s need. The doctor makes annual physical examinations on your child, and treats common illnesses. For most people, they desire a pediatrician in the child’s youngest years.

allergist

If you do observe your child having skin reactions or asthmatic conditions, then it is high time you visit an allergist. An allergist would test your child’s body sensitivity to know how much your child is affected to their environment.

endocrinologist

An endocrinologist basically checks your child’s hormones and body metabolism. If your child is diagnosed with diabetes type 1, the only place to bring him or her is the endocrinologist.

psychologist

Children have fragile minds and any shocking situation can keep them off balance. So when you do observe odd behaviors from your child, it is high time you visit the psychologist.

conclusion

There are number of choices you may need to keep a balanced pace on your child’s health. Be free to also ask your family doctor or any child doctor for help, if you do notice something strange from your child.
